intro: Cnidium athoum, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Cnidium athoum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
